block.p: Patricia Marie Murphy and Todd Matthew Stein were married yesterday at Great Meadow, an equestrian center in The Plains, Va. Norman E. Cartwright-Brown, a Virginia civil marriage celebrant, officiated.

The bride, 36, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the executive editor of The American Interest, a public affairs magazine in Washington. She graduated from Vanderbilt and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia.

Patricia Marie Murphy and Todd Matthew Stein were married yesterday at Great Meadow, an equestrian center in The Plains, Va. Norman E. Cartwright-Brown, a Virginia civil marriage celebrant, officiated.

Patricia Marie Murphy and Todd Matthew Stein were married yesterday at Great Meadow, an equestrian center in The Plains, Va. Norman E. Cartwright-Brown, a Virginia civil marriage celebrant, officiated.

The bride, 36, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the executive editor of The American Interest, a public affairs magazine in Washington. She graduated from Vanderbilt and received a master's degree in journalism from Columbia.

She is a daughter of Mary Kay Murphy and Michael C. Murphy of Duluth, Ga. The bride's father is a lawyer in Lawrenceville, Ga. Her mother is an associate vice president of the Morehouse School of Medicine in Atlanta, where she works on fund-raising; she is also on the board of education for the public schools of Gwinnett County, Ga.

The bridegroom, 33, is a lawyer with the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs in Washington. He graduated from Emory University and received a master's degree in literature from King's College London. His law degree is from Vanderbilt.

He is a son of Ellen Kierr Stein and Kenneth W. Stein, both of Atlanta. The bridegroom's mother is a real estate agent for Coldwell Banker, in Sandy Springs, Ga. His father is the William E. Schatten professor of contemporary Middle Eastern history and Israeli studies at Emory. The bridegroom is a stepson of Lynn Epstein.
